title: Drought, water overuse prompt Arizona to limit construction in some fast-growing parts of Phoenix - The Associated Press
summary: Arizona will impose restrictions on new housing construction in rapidly growing suburbs of metro Phoenix that rely on groundwater due to overuse and drought. Developers can still build if they find alternative water sources like surface or recycled water. The decision aims to ensure a sustainable water supply as projections show a significant unmet demand for groundwater in the future. Existing homeowners will not be affected by the new rules.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article discusses regulations aimed at promoting sustainability and responsible water management in response to groundwater depletion.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the article outlines changes in construction regulations that affect how developers source water for new housing projects, representing a significant alteration in the business process of construction in the area.
green_product: FALSE, as the article does not mention any specific good or service that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE, as the new restrictions on groundwater usage promote sustainable practices in the development and construction processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 236115 - New Single-Family Housing Construction (except For-Sale Builders), 237110 - Water and Sewer Line and Related Structures Construction, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services, 921120 - Legislative Bodies
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article does not present misleading information about environmental practices; rather, it discusses legitimate regulatory efforts to address water sustainability.

title: Targus Launches Eco-Friendly Backpack with Built-In Find My Locator to Easily Find Your Tech and Other Personal ... - PR Newswire
summary: Targus has launched the Cypress™ Hero Backpack, which is made from 26 recycled water bottles and features a built-in Find My Locator for tracking personal items. The backpack is designed for eco-conscious consumers and utilizes GRS-certified recycled materials, ensuring sustainability in its production. It includes compartments to protect laptops and everyday essentials while maintaining a user-friendly design.
green_innovation: TRUE: This innovation utilizes recycled materials and contributes to environmental sustainability by significantly reducing the environmental impact of the product's lifecycle.
business_innovation: TRUE: This product is a new and improved offering from Targus that significantly differs from their previous products by integrating eco-friendly features and technology.
green_product: TRUE: The backpack qualifies as a green product because it is made from recycled materials, reduces environmental impact, and supports sustainable usage.
green_process: TRUE: The manufacturing process involves recycling 26 plastic water bottles into new materials, demonstrating a method that minimizes waste and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 339940 - Office Supplies (except Paper) Manufacturing, 423440 - Other Commercial Equipment Merchant Wholesalers, 424120 - Stationery and Office Supplies Merchant Wholesalers, 448190 - Other Clothing Stores
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not exhibit characteristics of greenwashing as it clearly explains the eco-friendly materials used and the product's sustainable features without making misleading claims.

title: 30 sustainable and ethical fashion brands to shop now - Marie Claire UK
summary: The article discusses sustainable clothing brands that aim to reduce the environmental impact of fashion by focusing on ethical practices, sustainable materials, and transparency in their production processes. It highlights the importance of being able to differentiate between genuine sustainable practices and greenwashing tactics. Various brands are featured, showcasing their commitment to environmental sustainability through innovative practices like recycling materials and offering take-back schemes. Additionally, it provides tips on how consumers can identify genuine sustainable brands.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes sustainable clothing brands that implement practices contributing to environmental sustainability goals, such as using eco-friendly materials and minimizing waste.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article discusses new and improved business processes and products related to fashion that differ significantly from previous offerings, promoting ethical and sustainable practices.
green_product: TRUE, because the clothing items discussed are designed and manufactured to reduce environmental impact through sustainable materials and processes.
green_process: TRUE, as the brands utilize manufacturing methods that minimize waste and conserve natural resources, aligning with the definition of green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 448120 - Women's Clothing Stores, 315220 - Men's and Boys' Cut and Sew Apparel Manufacturing, 315240 - Women's, Boys', and Girls' Cut and Sew Apparel Manufacturing, 541614 - Process, Physical Distribution, and Logistics Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article emphasizes the importance of identifying genuine sustainable practices and provides guidelines to differentiate them from greenwashing, indicating that it does not endorse misleading environmental claims.

title: Novelis Enters Long-Term Agreement to Supply Aluminum Beverage Can Sheet to The Coca-Cola System - PR Newswire
summary: Novelis Inc. has signed a long-term contract with Coca-Cola Bottlers' Sales & Services Company to supply aluminum can sheet for Coca-Cola's brands, emphasizing their commitment to sustainability through closed-loop recycling. Novelis' new Bay Minette plant will focus on low-carbon aluminum production and recycling, expected to create around 1,000 jobs. This facility will be the first integrated aluminum manufacturing and recycling plant in the U.S. in nearly 40 years, operating on renewable energy and aiming for net carbon neutrality.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article describes Novelis' sustainable practices in aluminum production, particularly the closed-loop recycling process which significantly reduces environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE - The long-term contract to supply aluminum can sheet represents a significant improvement in Novelis' business processes and expands their market offering.
green_product: TRUE - The aluminum can sheet supplied by Novelis is designed and recycled in a way that minimizes environmental impact, enhancing sustainability in beverage packaging.
green_process: TRUE - The closed-loop recycling process employed by Novelis minimizes waste and conserves resources, aligning with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 331315 - Aluminum Sheet, Plate, and Foil Manufacturing; 331417 - Secondary Smelting and Alloying of Aluminum; 322121 - Paper (except Newsprint) Mills; 423510 - Metal Service Centers and Other Metal Merchant Wholesalers.
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not present any misleading claims about the environmental benefits; it reports factual commitments and actions towards sustainability and recycling.
